qas.question: What did the UN Command want to achieve with the armistice talks?

answers.text: recapture all of South Korea and to avoid losing territory

qas.question: What tactics were used by the PVA to coax the UN Command to continuing the war?
Was there a cease fire during the talks?

answers.text: Large-scale bombing of North Korea continued

qas.question: Who directed the armistice negotiation for the Chinese?

context: For the remainder of the Korean War the UN Command and the PVA fought, but exchanged little territory; the stalemate held. <a3_0>Large-scale bombing of North Korea continued<a3_0/>, and protracted armistice negotiations began 10 July 1951 at <a0_0>Kaesong<a0_0/>. On the Chinese side, <a4_0>Zhou Enlai<a4_0/> directed peace talks, and Li Kenong and Qiao Guanghua headed the negotiation team. Combat continued while the belligerents negotiated; the UN Command forces' goal was to <a1_0>recapture all of South Korea and to avoid losing territory<a1_0/>. The PVA and the KPA attempted similar operations, and later effected <a2_0>military and psychological operations<a2_0/> in order to test the UN Command's resolve to continue the war.
